title: Getting Started with SvelteKit ISR
description: Learn how to implement Incremental Static Regeneration in SvelteKit with Svelte 5 for optimal performance.

content.content: Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) is a powerful feature that allows you to update static content without rebuilding your entire site. In this post, we'll explore how to implement ISR in SvelteKit with Svelte 5.

ISR combines the benefits of static site generation with the flexibility of server-side rendering. Pages are pre-rendered at build time, but can be regenerated in the background when requests come in.

items: Fast page loads with pre-rendered content
Fresh content without full site rebuilds
Reduced build times for large sites

content.text: ISR is the perfect balance between static and dynamic content.
content.author: Rich Harris, Creator of Svelte

content.content: ISR in SvelteKit provides an excellent solution for sites that need both performance and fresh content. By implementing the patterns shown in this post, you can create a scalable and efficient web application.
